file_content.text: Go, please. Your Republic is waiting for you.
Tell me why, Jedi. I stand unique among all other men in the galaxy. Why must I be destroyed?
There is more to you than the First Son of the Emperor. That part, I must save.
I'm helping Master Syo.
Gone. He is... is--uhh!
You, and all the Children, threaten the innocents I swore to protect.
To save lives.
You've deceived, corrupted, murdered. Death is the least you deserve.
Because you're a monster.
I am not... I--uhh!
Now, Master Syo, while he's weak. Take control and unmask the other Children.
Syo, break his shield.
I won't allow you to....
I am the one who will not allow this, First Son. I know who I am. I am Syo Bakarn, I am a Jedi Master, and you have lost!
It... it's done. The shield is broken. The Children's last protection is gone.
You're safe. Your nightmare is over.
It's alright, Master.
No, it isn't.
What happened to the First Son? Is he gone, too?
And the First Son?
If there's a chance even one of the Children is still hidden, I must know.
Be absolutely certain.
I'm sure. They can't hide from the Jedi any longer. And I can feel them.
He's still here. Locked away but awake, like your Esh-kha.
I never suspected. How many died because I never suspected?
You can't forget all the good you have done as a Jedi, despite having such darkness inside you.
And how many have you saved?
She's quite right, Syo.
He's quite right, Syo.
I still have a task to complete.
All we can do now is look to the future.
I don't know.
Now is no time for weakness.
Pull yourself together.
Yes. Now, more than ever, I must be strong.
The First Son will never be free of my control again. I'll see to it, with the Council's help. And forgiveness.
I will always be here if you need me, Master Syo.
You have my help, too.
I see there is little more I can teach you.
There is still a battle to be fought for Corellia.
I must attend to the war.
If I am not--if the First Son is not shielding the other Children, hopefully the tide will soon turn.
If the First Son cannot be contained, you know there is only one way to be sure.
Your death may be necessary.
I'd rather die as a Jedi than return to the nightmare.
I should stay here to recover, away from... from everyone. And, thank you. For fighting when I could not.
You should go. Corellia and your Republic are waiting.
Syo. That's my name. That's who I--no! I can't stop him!
It will not end like this!
All things pass. Accept this, and the Force will embrace you.
You're dying. Calm your anger.
Denial. A Jedi's escape. You're less than my sisters who wander, unawakened.
Denial. A Jedi's escape. You're less than my brothers who wander, unawakened.
But I feel. I have lived.
This is the end, for you and all the Children of the Emperor.
Enough of this. [Kill him.]
Aggghhh!
Is ended. Is great triumph for you, Herald.
A good man is dead and his memory sullied.
Not a triumph, a loss.
To fight evil is no tragedy. Republic is saved.
Our friends are waiting for us.
We should go.
Seems quieter. But hunt's ending leaves silence.
After the crimes he committed, this was the only way it could end.
He deserved it.
Have saved many, and earned great glory. No prey is your equal now.
Outside waits.
Syo? Syo!
He was still there, Jedi. The First Son hadn't won completely.
I'm sorry, Tharan. There was nothing I could do.
I couldn't reach him.
You... you tried. And if anyone could have saved him, you'd be the one. I suppose that's a sort of comfort.
If he had survived, could Syo have lived with himself?
Think of Syo's guilt.
I don't know. I could have been there for him. This is intolerable.
No. Not Syo. He wasn't the one responsible for this.
Master Syo endured more than any of us at the hands of the First Son.
He suffered most.
You're right. And while we wait, more may be suffering in the battle overhead.
He is gone, but there are others who still need us.
We should rejoin the others.
How did we come to this, Jedi?
You're quite right. They should be told.
Syo could have questioned what was happening to him. He chose not to.
But he didn't stop it, either.
This isn't a fate I'd wish on my worst enemy. Ironic.
Goodbye, Syo. Knowing you made me... a redeemable man.
He's gone. We're safe. Weird, I feel sort of... empty.
We destroyed both a great evil, and a great force for good.
This was a hollow victory.
I guess we both need some time.
I'm going to focus on the "destroyed great evil" part, I think.
Hopefully that was enough to break the Imperial battle lines.
We need to rejoin our forces.
Right. And we should tell them the First Son's gone.
A rot in the heart of the Republic has been excised. That's a cause for celebration.
You should be happy.
I'm not going to celebrate killing a Jedi Master, whoever was in his head.
Let's get topside. I've got your back.
So end all traitors.
The man underneath suffered more than any of us.
No. Syo was a victim.
Doesn't get my sympathy. But you do.
The others will be worried about us.
Our friends should be told.
You're right.
This is merciful compared to the harm the First Son has done.
It's the least he deserved.
And Senator Grell's avenged.
Corellia's waiting.
I applaud you, Jedi. Your fortitude and courage are remarkable.
No one has ever proved themselves to me.
You will be free again, Master, I promise. Just hold on.
I came for Master Syo.
Please, Jedi. Syo has... has found his proper place. He doesn't have your strength, I'm afraid.
Syo is finally where he belongs. Silent, and out of reach, even for one with your talents.
The respect of one's enemy is a rare privilege.
Thank you.
You are a traitor, and the Children are cowards hiding behind endless lies.
Your respect means nothing.
You always did have an inexorable will.
Long ago, you showed you could step into the unknown without fear.
Learning the shielding technique was only more evidence of your fascinating mind.
You were gifted from birth, before you ever knew the word "Jedi."
And your willingness to destroy Lord Vivicar, at the cost of so many Jedi lives, proved you would be a formidable opponent.
If I had a second chance, I would seek another way.
I regret those deaths.
You'd deny yourself the chance to grow? Carrying great burdens is what makes us stronger.
I've only grown more powerful since Vivicar died. You missed your chance.
You should've killed me then.
Even dear Syo might have found your murder hard to explain away.
But then you chose to save Lord Vivicar, risking your own life. Intriguing.
What "intrigued" you?
Why?
You proved what you were willing to lose.
It was necessary.
I underestimated how powerful your trials would make you. But this sudden miscalculation? Not like you at all.
I'm more concerned with the present than the past.
I won't discuss this with you.
You should never have come here without your army's protection. Losing you will shatter the Rift Alliance. The Republic will collapse.
Fear, not war, will be the Republic's end. They will know the Children remain, shielded by my will, and that their last hope is dead.
I act as the Force guides me, and accept the consequences.
All happens as it must.
The Rift Alliance is more than one person, and the Republic is greater still.
I have faith in the Republic.
Even now, you cling to your convictions.
Killing you will deprive your brothers and sisters of their protection. There will be nowhere left to hide.
Your death breaks that shield.
Cutting to the heart of a problem, as usual.
Such a mind. You would have been unstoppable as one of us.
But it's too late. I cannot let you live.
We'll consider the First Son's ignominious defeat a bonus.
